#summary User help

The main interface for now is pytof.py, and it's text based.

{{{
[bsergean@marge1 scripts]$ python pytof.py -h
usage: python pytof.py <options>

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -i, --info            Print info about the collection [default = False]
  -f, --file-system     Extract album photo to OUTPUTDIR and stop
  -V, --version         display version
  -l LIBRARYPATH, --library=LIBRARYPATH
                        The iPhoto library directory path
  -x XMLFILENAME, --xml-file=XMLFILENAME
                        The iPhoto library XML file name
  -a ALBUMNAME, --album=ALBUMNAME
                        The iPhoto library album to process
  -o OUTPUTDIR, --output=OUTPUTDIR
                        The output directory [/home/bsergean/tmp +
                        out/ALBUMNAME]
}}}

Here is a sample output from a simple use of pytof.

{{{
[bsergean@flanders trunk]$ ./pytof.py -l /media/photos/iPhoto\ Library -x AlbumData.xml -a Berkeley
output dir is /home/bsergean/tmp
Parsing AlbumData.xml   [DONE]
Writing pictures 100%   [DONE]
}}}
